Percent_Complete_ProjectObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Percent_Complete_ProjectObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Percent_Complete_ProjectObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

Percent_Complete_Line_Data.description: The amount of revenue to be recognized at the line level for the current period.  If this is left empty it will be calculated based upon the percent complete.  If this is populated the percent complete may be adjusted to reflect this amount.

validation.validation: Contract Line Currency Reference cannot be modified.
Contract Line Amount cannot be modified.
Percent Complete Line Reference cannot be modified.
validation.description: Percent Complete Line Reference cannot be modified.

validation.validation: Sold-To Customer Reference cannot be modified.
validation.description: Sold-To Customer Reference cannot be modified.

validation.validation: Customer Contract Line Reference cannot be modified.
validation.description: Customer Contract Line Reference cannot be modified.

validation.validation: You can't create a Percent Complete if the customer contract lines are in canceled or completed statuses.
Current Revenue Amount for the contract line is too high and might over-recognize the revenue. Enter a lower Current Revenue Amount.
The sum of the Current Revenue Amount and the Cumulative Revenue to Date can't be a negative amount.

Percent_Complete_Project_Data.description: Set Actual Percent Complete to Zero

validation.validation: When you enable the Set Actual Percent Complete to Zero flag, specify a Note.
Actual Percent Complete must be 100 or less.
validation.description: Actual Percent Complete must be 100 or less.

validation.validation: Contract Value cannot be modified.
Currency Reference cannot be modified.
Only a valid Forecast Snapshot for the Billable Project may be entered.
When you override Estimated Hours to Complete or Actual Percent Complete, Note is required.
Actual Cost is invalid for Percent Complete Method of Hours.
Estimated Cost is invalid for Percent Complete Method of Hours.
When you override Estimated Cost or Actual Percent Complete, Note is required.
Estimated Hours to Complete is invalid for Percent Complete Method of Cost.

validation.validation: There are percent complete reviews with a status of Awaiting Review, Approval in Progress, Approved, or Completed, on or after the transaction end date.

validation.validation: Your customer contract line doesn’t have a revenue recognition schedule with Revenue Recognition Method matching the Percent Complete Method.
validation.description: Your customer contract line doesn’t have a revenue recognition schedule with Revenue Recognition Method matching the Percent Complete Method.

validation.validation: Project is inactive.
Enter Awaiting Review status only for Percent Complete.
Specify a Transaction End Date within 60 calendar days of the Current Date.
When you enable the Set Actual Percent Complete to Zero flag, specify an Actual Percent Complete, Cumulative Hours Worked and a Current Revenue Amount of zero.
